answer: The research areas in the Department of Chemical Engineering include Fluid Mechanics, Reaction Engineering, Thermodynamics, Transport Phenomena, and Process Systems Engineering.

question: Which department focuses on Geotechnical Engineering, Structural Engineering, and Transportation Engineering?
answer: The Department of Civil Engineering focuses on Geotechnical Engineering, Structural Engineering, and Transportation Engineering.

question: Which department includes courses on Power Systems and Electrical Machines?
answer: The Department of Electrical Engineering includes courses on Power Systems and Electrical Machines.

question: What are the major research themes in the Department of Mechanical Engineering?
answer: Major research themes in the Department of Mechanical Engineering include Solid Mechanics, Fluid Mechanics, Thermal Sciences, and Manufacturing.

question: What is the full name of the department with the abbreviation MT?
answer: The full name of the department with the abbreviation MT is the Department of Metallurgical Engineering and Materials Science.

question: Which department deals with Environmental Engineering and Water Resources?
answer: The Department of Civil Engineering deals with Environmental Engineering and Water Resources.

question: Which department covers VLSI, Embedded Systems, and Communication Systems?

question: What subjects are included in the Information Technology department?

question: What is the vision of the Farm Machinery & Power Engineering department?
answer: Farm technocrats support built up for mechanization, precision farming, resource conservation, energy base expansion to revolutionize farm productivity.

question: What is the mission of the Farm Machinery & Power Engineering department?
answer: The mission includes: Farm technocrats support built-up by strengthening teaching base; Expanding farm power availability through hi-tech mechanization; Conservation of bio-resources for supplementation of farm energy needs; Equipping farmers and agricultural workers with state-of the-art farm technology

question: Does the Farm Machinery & Power Engineering department offer a B.Tech program?
answer: The Farm Machinery & Power Engineering department offers a B.Tech program.

question: Does the Farm Machinery & Power Engineering department offer a M.Tech program?
answer: The Farm Machinery & Power Engineering department has 194 students enrolled in the M.Tech program.

question: Does the Farm Machinery & Power Engineering department offer a Ph.D. program?
answer: The Farm Machinery & Power Engineering department has 48 students enrolled in the Ph.D. program.

question: How many research projects has the Farm Machinery & Power Engineering department completed?
answer: The department has completed 24 research projects.

question: What is an ongoing project in the Farm Machinery & Power Engineering department?
answer: Project: Energy in Agriculture and Agro–Based Industries (EAAI), funded by ICAR, New Delhi.

question: What is an ongoing project in the Farm Machinery & Power Engineering department?
answer: Project: Mechanization of Animal Husbandry (Utilization of Animal Energy with Enhanced System Efficiency), funded by ICAR, New Delhi.

question: What is the testing center in the Farm Machinery & Power Engineering department?
answer: The department has a testing center named: Implement Testing and Training Centre.

question: What is the approving authority for testing in the Farm Machinery & Power Engineering department?
answer: The approving authority is: Department of Agriculture & Cooperation, Ministry of Agriculture, Government of India.

question: What technologies have been developed by the Farm Machinery & Power Engineering department?
answer: Technologies include: Pantnagar Zero-till ferti-seed drill; Axial flow multi-crop thresher; Soybean thresher; Pant spiked clod crusher; Multi-crop seed drill; Sugarcane interculture-cum-earthing equipment; Mango Guthali (stone) decorticator; Differential speed expanding pitch fruits and vegetable grader; Tomato seed extractor; Okra thresher; Pant adjustable yoke; Pant adjustable collar harness; Wheat thresher for hilly region; Multicrop thresher for hilly region

question: What is the Mechanical Engineering department about?
answer: Title: : College of Technology ::. FARM MACHINERY & POWER ENGINEERING POST HARVEST PROCESS & FOOD ENGINEERING SOIL & WATER CONSERVATION ENGINEERING WELCOME TO MECHANICAL ENGINEERING DEPARTMENT The Department of Mechanical Engineering at College of Technology, G. B. Pant University of Agriculture & Technology, Pantnagar offers Mechanical Engineering program at the Bachelor level since July 1966. Mechanical Engineering Department is one of the oldest departments and is considered to be highly renowned department of the College. The department is vibrant and it organizes several activities throughout the year. The strong and interactive curriculum and hands on learning has the capability of taking the students’ career to the next level - be in the professional engineering practice or in advanced study. The department, right from its inception, is focusing on quality teaching along with integrated laboratory experience. The department is also running Post Graduate Programs in Thermal Engineering and Design and Production Engineering since 1984. The department started its Ph.D. program in Mechanical Engineering in the year 1985. The Department feels proud of achievements of its alumni, who have excelled in various walks of life. The department is one of the largest departments of the college consisting of dynamic, research oriented and well qualified faculty majority having Ph.D. degrees from IIT’s, NITs and other reputed institutions. The department has the most modern infrastructure to undertake effective teaching, research and developmental activities in its 23 numbers of laboratories which include Refrigeration and Air conditioning, Gas Dynamics, Heat Transfer, Internal Combustion Engine, Solar Energy, Biomass, Stress Analysis, Kinematics, Tribology, Material Science and Metallurgy along with a big central workshop comprising of facilities with modern machines. The department process highly sophisticated and imported equipment that include 25 kN Serve Control Fatigue Testing Machine 100 /10 kN Universal Testing Machine, Rotary Particle Depositor and Particle qualifier Variable Compression Ratio SI Engine Computerized Sensor based SI Engine Test Rig. Freezing Equpiment for Experiment for freezing of Fruits & Vegetables In addition to above equipments, department has well developed Computer Aided Design Laboratory with latest Work Station, Servers, Computers and software like: ITI simulation X and other general packages NPTI Multimedia CBT learning package The department has a policy to periodically update the course curriculum in order to fulfill the present day need of the teaching learning process so as to accustom students with a perfect blend of intellectual and practical experiences that helps them to serve the society and address a variety of needs. For Departmental Brochure Click Here Vision:- To become a nationally recognized leader in technical education & research and capable of making significant contribution to the society in the field of Mechanical Engineering To strive for excellence in teaching and research and to promote academic growth by offering state-of-the-art facilities to undergraduate and postgraduate programmes. To generate knowledge by providing cutting-edge research facilities for overall development of students and society. Engineering knowledge: Apply the knowledge of mathematics, science, engineeringfundamentals, and an engineering specialization to the solution of complex engineering problems. Problem analysis: Identify, formulate, review research literature, and analyze complexengineering problems reaching substantiated conclusions using first principles of mathematics, natural sciences, and engineering sciences. Design/development of solutions: Design solutions for complex engineering problems anddesign system components or processes that meet the specified needs with appropriate consideration for the public health and safety, and the cultural, societal, and environmental considerations. Conduct investigations of complex problems: Use research-based knowledge and researchmethods including design of experiments, analysis and interpretation of data, and synthesis of the information to provide valid conclusions. Modern tool usage: Create, select, and apply appropriate techniques, resources, and modernengineering and IT tools including prediction and modeling to complex engineering activities with an understanding of the limitations. The engineer and society: Apply reasoning informed by the contextual knowledge to assesssocietal, health, safety, legal and cultural issues and the consequent responsibilities relevant to the professional engineering practice. Environment and sustainability: Understand the impact of the professional engineering solutionsin societal and environmental contexts, and demonstrate the knowledge of, and need for sustainable development. Ethics: Apply ethical principles and commit to professional ethics and responsibilities and norms ofthe engineering practice. Individual and team work: Function effectively as an individual, and as a member or leader indiverse teams, and in multidisciplinary settings. Communication: Communicate effectively on complex engineering activities with the engineeringcommunity and with society at large, such as, being able to comprehend and write effective reports and design documentation, make effective presentations, and give and receive clear instructions. Project management and finance: Demonstrate knowledge and understanding of theengineering and management principles and apply these to one’s own work, as a member and leader in a team, to manage projects and in multidisciplinary environments. Life-long learning: Recognize the need for, and have the preparation and ability to engage inindependent and life-long learning in the broadest context of technological change. PEO1: Produce engineers with strong fundamentals and adaptive skills to serve existing & evolving industries PEO2: Conduct research focused on providing a technological edge to India in general and Uttarakhand in particular. PEO3: Develop appropriate technologies for the prosperity of people in rural areas of India. Consistency of PEOs with Mission of the Department PEO1: Produce engineers with strong fundamentals and adaptive skills to serve existing & evolving industries	3	3 PEO2: Conduct research focused on providing a technological edge to India in general and Uttarakhand in particular	2	3 PEO3: Develop appropriate technologies for the prosperity of people in rural areas of India	3	3 PSO1: Ability to acquire the latest knowledge of engineering principles and managerial skills to prepare themselves for emerging needs of the industry. PSO2: Ability to inculcate creative thinking to take up challenges in interdisciplinary areas and to provide real-life solutions. PSO3: Ability to analyze and design useful engineering systems for society. The College of Technology reserves the right to change the information published on this site at any point of time without prior or further notification. The correct details regarding Posts/Vacancies/Designation/Publications etc. pertaining to the user’s queries are to be provided by C.P.O. office/Concerned Unit Office after its verification.

question: What is the Swce Engineering department about?
answer: Title: : College of Technology ::. .:: College of Technology ::. *   [Electronics & Communication Engineering](http://www.gbpuat-tech.ac.in/electronicsEngg.php?id=1) *   [Farm Machinery & Power Engineering](http://www.gbpuat-tech.ac.in/farmEngg.php?id=1) *   [Master of Computer Applications](http://www.gbpuat-tech.ac.in/mca.php?id=1) *   [Industrial & Production Engineering](http://www.gbpuat-tech.ac.in/productionEngg.php?id=1) *   [Irrigation & Drainage Engineering](http://www.gbpuat-tech.ac.in/irrigationEngg.php?id=1) *   [Post Harvest Process & Food Engineering](http://www.gbpuat-tech.ac.in/phpfeEngg.php?id=1) *   [Soil & Water Conservation Engineering](http://www.gbpuat-tech.ac.in/swceEngg.php?id=1) Welcome to Soil & Water Conservation Engineering Department [Trainings/FDP/Seminar/Conference Attended by Faculty](http://www.gbpuat-tech.ac.in/swceEngg.php?id=12) [Organised by Department](http://www.gbpuat-tech.ac.in/swceEngg.php?id=17) ![Image 3: Head SWCE Engg.](http://www.gbpuat-tech.ac.in/online/images/25.03.2021_1616667637915.jpg) Department of Soil & Water Conservation Engineering The College of Agricultural Engineering was established in this prestigious university in 1962 with Soil and Water conservation Engineering (SWCE) as its integral component. In the year 1984, based on the recommendations of a high level committee, the department of Agricultural Engineering was reorganised and Department of SWCE became as an independent department along with three other departments. The Department of SWCE offers B Tech UG programs jointly while M Tech and Ph D programs are offered independently. The department is privileged to have a mix of senior and younger highly competent faculty. As per mandate, the department is actively involved in Teaching, Research and extension activities. It has good facilities including several laboratories and computing facilities. *   [Pantnagar Technology Alumni Association](http://ptaa-gbpuat.com/) *   [Engineering & Technology Society](http://www.gbpuat-tech.ac.in/ETS/index.html) *   [Pantnagar Technology Alumni Association](http://www.gbpuat-tech.ac.in/ptaa.php?id=1) *   [Internal Notices and Circulars](http://www.gbpuat-tech.ac.in/announcement.php?id=1) Govind Ballabh Pant University of Agriculture and Technology, **Disclaimer:** The facts published on this website are for immediate information only and no legal claim can be made for any damage caused by using the content of this site. question: What is the Phpfe Engineering department about?
answer: Title: : College of Technology ::. .:: College of Technology ::. *   [Electronics & Communication Engineering](http://www.gbpuat-tech.ac.in/electronicsEngg.php?id=1) *   [Farm Machinery & Power Engineering](http://www.gbpuat-tech.ac.in/farmEngg.php?id=1) *   [Master of Computer Applications](http://www.gbpuat-tech.ac.in/mca.php?id=1) *   [Industrial & Production Engineering](http://www.gbpuat-tech.ac.in/productionEngg.php?id=1) *   [Irrigation & Drainage Engineering](http://www.gbpuat-tech.ac.in/irrigationEngg.php?id=1) *   [Post Harvest Process & Food Engineering](http://www.gbpuat-tech.ac.in/phpfeEngg.php?id=1) *   [Soil & Water Conservation Engineering](http://www.gbpuat-tech.ac.in/swceEngg.php?id=1) Welcome to Post Harvest Process & Food Engineering Department [Trainings/FDP/Seminar/Conference Attended by Faculty](http://www.gbpuat-tech.ac.in/phpfeEngg.php?id=12) [Organised by Department](http://www.gbpuat-tech.ac.in/phpfeEngg.php?id=17) ![Image 3: Head IPED Engg](http://www.gbpuat-tech.ac.in/online/images/16.08.2021_1629095632412.jpg) Department of Post Harvest Process & Food Engineering The Department of Post Harvest Process and Food Engineering is a constituent department of the College of Technology of the University. The department was created as a result of the restructuring of the Department of Agricultural Engineering in 1984. The department was also identified as a Centre of Advanced Studies in Post Harvest Technology by FAO/UNDP. The department deals with the processing and utilization of food materials. It places a balanced emphasis on teaching and research activities. Over the years the department has made significant contributions in various areas of Harvest and Post Harvest Processing, Food Engineering and Food Biotechnology. It has developed a number of processes, technologies and equipment for the related industries and farmers. The Courses are as follows: *   M.Tech (Process & Food Engineering) *   M.Tech (Food & Bioprocess Engineering) *   Ph.D. (Process & Food Engineering) *   [Pantnagar Technology Alumni Association](http://ptaa-gbpuat.com/) *   [Engineering & Technology Society](http://www.gbpuat-tech.ac.in/ETS/index.html) *   [Pantnagar Technology Alumni Association](http://www.gbpuat-tech.ac.in/ptaa.php?id=1) *   [Internal Notices and Circulars](http://www.gbpuat-tech.ac.in/announcement.php?id=1) Govind Ballabh Pant University of Agriculture and Technology, **Disclaimer:** The facts published on this website are for immediate information only and no legal claim can be made for any damage caused by using the content of this site.
